TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager, class System.IServiceProvider

Docs.summary: Manages design-time serialization to and from extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) for workflows.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
A workflow or activity designer can use WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager to access services useful to managing design-time serialization processes. For example, WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager can be used to create objects, look up types, identify objects, and customize the serialization of particular types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager manager) cil managed

Docs.param: The with which to initialize the .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddSerializationProvider(class System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider provider) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds the specified serialization provider to the serialization manager.

remarks.format: ## Remarks AddSerializationProvider adds a custom serialization provider to the serialization manager. Serialization providers can provide custom serializers for a particular type of object or set of types of objects. During serialization, each custom serialization provider is queried to return a serializer for a specific data type, if it can provide one. The serialization manager uses the custom serializer provided by this method before using the default serializer for a particular type.

Docs.summary: Gets a stack-based, user-defined storage area that is useful for communication between serializers.
Docs.value: A that contains information about the current object being serialized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Some serializers require information about the context of an object to correctly persist their state. Context enables a serializer to set data about the context of an object that it is serializing to a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ContextStack> where another serializer can access it.

MemberSignature.Value: public object GetSerializer (Type objectType, Type serializerType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetSerializer(class System.Type objectType, class System.Type serializerType) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Type> for which to retrieve the serializer.
The <xref:System.Type> of the serializer to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Returns a serializer of the specified type for an object of the specified type.
Docs.returns: The requested serializer, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if no appropriate serializer can be located.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Type GetType(class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName xmlQualifiedName) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> of the type to load.
Docs.summary: Returns that type associated with the specified XML qualified name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An XML qualified name is a namespace-qualified local name, in the format of namespace:localname.
Because prefixes are only required when XML is persisted or read, they are irrelevant for <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> objects. It is the responsibility of the user to ensure the local name does not contain a ":"

Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName GetXmlQualifiedName (Type type, out string prefix);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName GetXmlQualifiedName(class System.Type type, string prefix) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Type> for which to return the XML-qualified name.
When this method returns, contains the XML prefix for the qualified name or an empty string if no prefix is defined. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Returns the XML-qualified name associated with the specified type.
Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the assembly that is associated with the current serializer.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly> that is associated with the current serializer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReportError(object errorInformation) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks `errorInformation` can be of any object type. If it is an exception, the message of the exception is extracted and reported to the user. If it is any other type, <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> is called to display the information to the user.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the serialization manager to use with the current serializer.
Docs.value: The to use with the current serializer.

MemberSignature.Value: object IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance (Type type, System.Collections.ICollection arguments, string name, bool addToContainer);

.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance object System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance(class System.Type type, class System.Collections.ICollection arguments, string name, bool addToContainer) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the arguments for `type`.

The name of the object. This name can be used to access the object later using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.GetInstance%2A>. If a null reference ( in Visual Basic) is passed, the object is still created but cannot be accessed by name.
to add the object to the design container; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type and adds it to a collection of named instances.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `addToContainer` is set to `true`, the object must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> for this to have any effect.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance object System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.GetInstance(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the object to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Returns an instance of a created object of the specified name.
Docs.returns: An instance of the object with the given name, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if no object by that name can be found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `name` must be set through a prior call to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance string System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.GetName(object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Object> for which to retrieve the name.
Docs.summary: Returns the name of the specified object.
Docs.returns: The name of the object, or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if the object is unnamed.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of properties that can be serialized with available serializers.
Docs.value: A that contains the properties to serialize.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can contain an empty collection. A serializer should never assume that any properties exist.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.SetName(object instance, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name to assign to the object.
Docs.summary: Sets the name of the specified existing object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.SetName%2A> is useful when you need to create and then name an instance of an object without using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance%2A>.
